Explanation: Matches any single character (except newline characters)
Matches the start of a string
Example: ^hello matches "hello world" but not "the hello there"

Explanation: Matches the end of a string
Example: world$ matches "hello world" but not "hello the world"

Explanation: Matches the preceding character 0 or more times
Matches the preceding character 1 or more times
Matches the preceding character 0 or 1 time
Matches a single character from within the brackets
Matches a single character NOT within the brackets

Example: \d\d\d-\d\d\d-\d\d\d\d matches a US phone number pattern

Explanation: Matches any alphanumeric character or underscore
Matches any whitespace character (spaces, tabs, newlines)
Example: \s+ matches one or more whitespace characters
